data.title: Multi-socket plug adaptors
data.solution:
import sys
n,m,p = map(int, input().split())

# mathematical solution
print(0 if n == 0 else (n+(p-1)*m)//2)

sys.exit(0)

# algorithmic solution
if n == 0:
    # no plug
    print(0)
else:
    # at least one plug on the wall, this one can be multiplied by (p-1)*m
    plugs = n
    for _ in range(m):
        plugs += (p-1) # because it gives p new plugs, but takes 1 existing plug
    # divided by 2 because need 1 for central unit and 1 for the screen.
    print(plugs//2)
data.statement:
You want to organize a big Clash of Code event in your enterprise, where all developers will meet, clash, and eat pizzas.

But you are wondering whether there will be enough electricity plugs for all of them to play in one room.
The selected room may have some outlets on the wall, and you know you can ask the IT department for multi-socket plug adaptors (note that in French it is simply called a "multiprise" üòÅ)
In the room there are [[N]] wall outlets. You can ask for maximum [[M]] adaptors that can have from {{1}} to [[P]] sockets on them.

How many desktop computers can you plug, containing at least one central unit and one screen?

Note that adaptors can be plugged on the wall or another adaptor.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You want to organize a big Clash of Code event in your enterprise, where all developers will meet, clash, and eat pizzas.

But you are wondering whether there will be enough electricity plugs for all of them to play in one room.
The selected room may have some outlets on the wall, and you know you can ask the IT department for multi-socket plug adaptors (note that in French it is simply called a "multiprise" üòÅ)
In the room there are N wall outlets. You can ask for maximum M adaptors that can have from 1 to P sockets on them.

How many desktop computers can you plug, containing at least one central unit and one screen?

Note that adaptors can be plugged on the wall or another adaptor.
Input
Line 1 : 3 space-separated integers: N the number of wall outlets, M the numbers of adaptors you can ask for, and P the number of sockets on the adaptors.
Output
One line: an integer, the total number of computers that can be plugged.
Constraints
0 ≤ N ≤ 100
0 ≤ M ≤ 100
1 ≤ P ≤ 100
Example
Input
2 3 3
Output
4
